body:
We've run affine registration to talairach using FreeSurfer (which we also used for preprocessing like skull stripping).  We used the `recon-all` for this, which performs a number of analysis steps, since we use the data for various other projects (see  https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/fswiki/recon-all  for more details). However, you can probably get away with using http://freesurfer.net/fswiki/talairach if all you'd like to do is the affine registration

In general, ANTs will also do affine registration, and if that's the main operation you're interested in, perhaps you should simply use ANTs. You need to set the number of affine iterations to non-zero (e.g. `1000x1000x1000x1000`), and the number of deformable iterations to 0. 

Finally, to run deformable registration with ANTs (if you've performed affine separately), use 0 affine iterations, as follows.

Assuming `ants_cmd` is the path to the `ANTS` command, `output_core` is an output folder, `fixed_file` and `moving_file` are paths to the appropriate files, such as affinely registered subject and atlas, you can use: 
```
${ants_cmd} 3 -m CC[${fixed_file},${moving_file},1,4] -t Syn[0.25] -o ${output_core}/ants --number-of-affine-iterations 0x0 -i 201x201x201 -r Gauss[9,0.2]
```

issue.title: Can you tell me the command to preprocess images with freesurfer?
issue.body: My email is fanfanda@ict.ac.cn. Thanks very much!

issue.title: test_seg.npz
issue.body: hi,Your paper says that the data is done with freesurfer. Can you elaborate on how test_seg.npz is done with freesurfer?

issue.title: About the affine transformation between moved image and the fixed image
issue.body:
Hello, I have read your paper and your work is very nice.
I would appreciate it if you could answer my questions. There is no affine transformation in the test image in your paper. I don't know whether the code can handle the situation if there has a violent affine transformation between the fixed and moved image?

issue.title: How to prepare the training data
issue.body: Hi，I have read your paper and want to run this code with my own data，so could you please tell me the general steps about how to prepare the training data，now I only have some nifti format T1-MRI data ，Do I need to follow the steps in paper strictly? such as resample,preprocess by freesurfer，crop to 160*192*224 etc.

issue.title: about dataset
issue.body: Hi,when I download the ADNI (1,2,3,go) dataset,there are more than 10000 MRI images.But in your paper there are total 7829 datas.So which ADNI dataset do you use?  And how to generator the Atlas image? Thank you very much.

issue.title: Run Out Of Memory on RTX 3090
issue.body:
**Task** (what are you trying to do/register?)

I wanted to train my own dataset to do the scan-to-scan registration. (GPU: RTX 3090, 24GB memory)

**What have you tried**

I used ```voxelmorph/scripts/train.py``` to obtain the scan-to-scan deformation field model

**Details of experiments**

The CT scans I used are in high resolution which are 512x512x(# of slices). If I did not downsample the scans and start training directly, the GPU memory will run out of. However, if I used ```Scipy``` to pad and downsample images to 256x256x128, the training result was very bad. Can anyone help me solve this issue and provide me some suggestions? Thanks!!!
